body:
### Problem

Documentation of `vim.lsp.config` says that the `root_markers` can take sublist to search project root by any of listed files in that sublist, but function that is called later(`vim.fs.root`) produces error that it does not allow sublist to be item of the filename enumeration

### Steps to reproduce

1. Setup pyright lsp. Bug itself does not happens only with "pyright", but in my setup it is the only lsp i'm using.
2. Set this into configuration:
  ```python
  vim.lsp.config("pyright", {root_markers = {{"pyproject.toml", "poetry.lock", "uv.lock"}, ".jj", ".git"}})
  ```
3. Open any python file


### Expected behavior

Find first ancestor with any of the pyproject.toml, poetry.lock, uv.lock, .jj, .git files(or directories) present

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

0.11.1

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

Don't have information

### Operating system/version

Debian GNU/Linux bookworm 12.10 x86_64

### Terminal name/version

Ghostty/1.0.1-main+6508fec9

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-ghostty

### Installation

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/INSTALL.md#pre-built-archives-2
